summary: In the courtroom, Alice finds herself growing larger and more frustrated with the absurd trial of the Knave of Hearts. The King and Queen demand Alice's evidence, but she claims to know nothing about the case. The trial is further complicated by the introduction of a mysterious set of verses, which the King and jury struggle to interpret. Alice challenges the King's logic and refuses to leave the court despite being declared too tall. The Queen insists on pronouncing the sentence before the verdict, leading to chaos. Alice, now fully grown, defies the Queen and declares the courtroom a pack of cards, causing the trial to dissolve into absurdity.

actions: declares the courtroom a pack of cards
throws an inkstand at the Lizard
says he didn't write the verses

key_events: Alice upsets the jury-box and begins picking up the jurymen.
The King declares the trial cannot proceed until the jurymen are back in their places.
Alice claims she knows nothing about the case.
The White Rabbit introduces a mysterious set of verses.
The King and jury struggle to interpret the verses.
Alice challenges the King's logic and refuses to leave the court.
The Queen insists on pronouncing the sentence before the verdict.
Alice declares the courtroom a pack of cards, causing chaos.
